be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.data

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.data.Data

  • public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    Non sparse representation of a data matrix with class labels. The variables can be either continuous or categorical.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Data(double[][] d, int[] labels, boolean[] isCat)
      Creates a Data object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Data

        public Data(double[][] d,
    int[] labels,
    boolean[] isCat)
        Creates a Data object
        Parameters:
        d - the data matrix consisting of n samples in a p dimensional space. The levels of categorical variables should be encoded as numeric (per dimension). d[i][j] is the value of the j-th dimension of the i-th data point.
        labels - the n class labels encoded as integers from 0 to number of classes - 1
        isCat - a boolean vector of size p indicating for each variable if it is categorical (true) or continuous (false).

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public double[][] getData()
        The data is represented as an two dimensional array. Let double[][] dataMatrix = d.getData(); then d[i][j] is the value of the j-th dimension of the i-th data point.
        Returns:
        the data matrix

      • getN

        public int getN()
        Returns:
        the number n of rows of the data matrix

      • getP

        public int getP()
        Returns:
        the number p of columns of the data matrix

      • getLabels

        public int[] getLabels()
        Returns:
        the label vector

      • getLabelLvls

        public int[] getLabelLvls()
        Returns:
        one occurrence of each class label (sorted by increasing order)

      • getIsCat

        public boolean[] getIsCat()
        Returns:
        a vector indicating if variables are categorical

      • getNumberOfClasses

        public int getNumberOfClasses()
        Returns:
        the number of different class labels

      • getNumberOfClassesIn

        public int getNumberOfClassesIn(int[] sampleIds)
        Computes the number of classes in a subset of the dataset.
        Parameters:
        sampleIds - is an array of samples indices to be taken into account
        Returns:
        the number of classes in the samples of samplesIds

      • getLevelsOfCatVar

        public double[] getLevelsOfCatVar(int feat)
        For a categorical variable, gives an array of levels. For continuous variables, returns null.
        Parameters:
        feat - is the index of a variable
        Returns:
        an array containing one occurrence of each level of variable feat

      • getRowRange

        public int[] getRowRange()
        Returns:
        an array containing [0,1,...,nrow-1]

      • getColRange

        public int[] getColRange()
        Returns:
        an array containing [0,1,...,ncol-1]

      • getMajorityClass

        public int[] getMajorityClass(int[] sampleIds)
        Computes the majority class in a subsample of the dataset
        Parameters:
        sampleIds - an array indicating the indices of the samples to consider
        Returns:
        an array containing the majority classes. It contains more than one element only if several classes are equally most represented.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
